name: Financial Transaction
description: The Financial Transaction segment (FT1) contains information about financial transactions that are charges or credits applied to a patient account. It supports billing workflows including procedure charges, service fees, adjustments, payments, and insurance claims. The FT1 segment captures detailed billing information including amounts, codes, providers, and timing for healthcare financial management.

cardinality.note: Multiple FT1 segments can be used for multiple financial transactions

FT1.1.name: Set ID - FT1
FT1.1.description: This field contains the sequence number for the FT1 segment when multiple financial transactions are present in a single message.
FT1.1.generationHint: Sequential numbering: 1, 2, 3, etc. for multiple transactions

FT1.2.name: Transaction ID
FT1.2.description: This field contains a unique identifier for the financial transaction within the system.

FT1.3.name: Transaction Batch ID
FT1.3.description: This field identifies the batch that this transaction belongs to for batch processing purposes.
FT1.3.generationHint: Batch identifier for grouping related transactions

FT1.4.name: Transaction Date
FT1.4.description: This field contains the date when the financial transaction occurred or was posted.
FT1.4.generationHint: Service date or posting date in YYYYMMDD format

FT1.5.name: Transaction Posting Date
FT1.5.description: This field contains the date when the transaction was posted to the patient account.
FT1.5.generationHint: Account posting timestamp - may differ from service date

FT1.6.name: Transaction Type
FT1.6.description: This field indicates the type of financial transaction. Values from HL7 Table 0017 - transaction type.

FT1.7.name: Transaction Code
FT1.7.description: This field contains the procedure or service code for the transaction. Typically CPT, HCPCS, or revenue codes.
FT1.7.generationHint: Use appropriate coding system: CPT for procedures, HCPCS for supplies, Revenue codes for facilities

FT1.8.name: Transaction Description
FT1.8.description: This field contains a human-readable description of the transaction or service provided.
FT1.8.generationHint: Plain text description matching the procedure/service code

FT1.9.name: Transaction Description - Alt
FT1.9.description: This field contains an alternative description of the transaction, often for different reporting purposes.
FT1.9.generationHint: Alternative description for billing or reporting purposes

FT1.10.name: Transaction Quantity
FT1.10.description: This field contains the quantity or number of units for the transaction.
FT1.10.generationHint: Unit count: 1 for single procedures, higher for supplies or recurring services

FT1.11.name: Transaction Amount - Extended
FT1.11.description: This field contains the total amount for the transaction (unit amount × quantity).
FT1.11.generationHint: Total charge amount format: NNNN.NN^USD (positive for charges, negative for credits)

FT1.12.name: Transaction Amount - Unit
FT1.12.description: This field contains the unit amount or rate for a single unit of the transaction.
FT1.12.generationHint: Per-unit price: individual procedure cost or supply unit cost

FT1.13.name: Department Code
FT1.13.description: This field identifies the department or cost center responsible for the transaction.
FT1.13.generationHint: Revenue center or department where service was provided

FT1.14.name: Insurance Plan ID
FT1.14.description: This field identifies the insurance plan associated with this transaction for billing purposes.
FT1.14.generationHint: Insurance plan identifier for transaction billing allocation

FT1.15.name: Insurance Amount
FT1.15.description: This field contains the amount that the insurance is expected to pay for this transaction.

FT1.16.name: Assigned Patient Location
FT1.16.description: This field identifies the patient location where the service was provided.
FT1.16.generationHint: Service location: room, department, or facility where care was provided

FT1.17.name: Fee Schedule
FT1.17.description: This field identifies the fee schedule used to determine the transaction amount.
FT1.17.generationHint: Fee schedule determines pricing basis for the transaction

FT1.18.name: Patient Type
FT1.18.description: This field categorizes the patient type for billing purposes. Values from HL7 Table 0018 - patient type.
FT1.18.generationHint: Patient status determines billing rules and rates

FT1.19.name: Diagnosis Code - FT1
FT1.19.description: This field contains the diagnosis code associated with this transaction for billing and coding purposes.

validValues.description: Encounter for general adult medical examination without abnormal findings

FT1.19.generationHint: ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes supporting medical necessity for billing

FT1.20.name: Performed By Code
FT1.20.description: This field identifies the healthcare provider who performed the service or procedure for this transaction.
FT1.20.generationHint: Rendering provider information for billing and credentialing

FT1.21.name: Ordered By Code
FT1.21.description: This field identifies the healthcare provider who ordered the service or procedure for this transaction.
FT1.21.generationHint: Ordering provider information for billing authorization

FT1.22.name: Unit Cost
FT1.22.description: This field contains the actual cost to provide one unit of the service or item.
FT1.22.generationHint: Internal cost accounting - differs from charge amount

FT1.23.name: Filler Order Number
FT1.23.description: This field contains the filler order number when the transaction is associated with a specific order.
FT1.23.generationHint: Link to order fulfillment system for transaction tracking

FT1.24.name: Entered By Code
FT1.24.description: This field identifies the person who entered the financial transaction into the system.
FT1.24.generationHint: User who posted the transaction for audit trail purposes

FT1.25.name: Procedure Code
FT1.25.description: This field contains an additional procedure code that may be related to the transaction.
FT1.25.generationHint: Secondary procedure code for complex billing scenarios

FT1.26.name: Procedure Code Modifier
FT1.26.description: This field contains modifiers that provide additional information about how the procedure was performed.

validValues.description: Significant, separately identifiable evaluation and management service

FT1.26.generationHint: CPT modifiers that affect reimbursement or indicate special circumstances

examples: FT1|1|TXN20250115001|BATCH001|20250115|20250115120000|CG|99213^Office visit, established patient, level 3^CPT|Office Visit Level 3||1|150.00^USD|150.00^USD|FAMILY^Family Medicine^LOCAL||120.00^USD|3WEST^301^A^HOSPITAL|||I|I10^Essential hypertension^ICD10|12345^PHYSICIAN^ATTENDING^MD|12345^PHYSICIAN^ATTENDING^MD|75.00^USD||54321^BILLING^CLERK^|99213^Office visit, established patient, level 3^CPT|
notes: FT1 segment is essential for healthcare billing and revenue cycle management
Transaction Date (FT1.4), Transaction Type (FT1.6), and Transaction Code (FT1.7) are required
Multiple FT1 segments can represent different charges for the same encounter
Amounts can be positive (charges) or negative (credits, adjustments, payments)
Diagnosis codes support medical necessity for billing compliance
Provider identification is critical for billing and compliance requirements
Procedure modifiers affect reimbursement rates and billing accuracy

conditional.FT1.1: Required when multiple FT1 segments are present
conditional.FT1.10: Should be provided for quantity-based billing
conditional.FT1.11: Total amount should equal unit amount × quantity when both present
conditional.FT1.19: Diagnosis codes important for billing compliance and medical necessity

relationships.FT1.11_FT1.12_FT1.10: Extended amount should equal unit amount × quantity
relationships.FT1.4_FT1.5: Posting date should be equal to or after transaction date
relationships.FT1.6_FT1.11: Credit transactions should have negative amounts
relationships.FT1.7_FT1.8: Description should match the procedure code

validation.FT1.6: Must be valid HL7 Table 0017 transaction type
validation.FT1.7: Should be valid CPT, HCPCS, or revenue code
validation.FT1.17: Must be valid fee schedule code when present
validation.FT1.18: Must be valid HL7 Table 0018 patient type when present
validation.FT1.11: Amount should be reasonable for the procedure type
